pma:database.name: neogame
pma:database.pma:table: CREATE TABLE `encounters` ( `id` int(3) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, `strName` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `strDesc` longtext NOT NULL, `strImg` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'EncBlank.png', `nTreasureID` int(3) NOT NULL DEFAULT '3', `nRemoveTreasureID` int(4) NOT NULL DEFAULT '3', `aConditions` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '1', `aPreConditions` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `fPrice` float NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `aResponses` longtext NOT NULL, `aMinimapHexes` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `bRemoveCreatures` tinyint(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `bRemoveUsed` tinyint(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `nItemsID` int(3) NOT NULL DEFAULT '3', `nCreatureID` int(3) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `ptCreatureHex` varchar(9) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0,0', `ptTeleport` varchar(9) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0,0', `ptEditor` varchar(24) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0,0', `nType` tinyint(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `fLootChance` float NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `fAccidentChance` float NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `fCreatureChance` float NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `vAccidents` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '1', `vLoot` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '3', PRIMARY KEY (`id`) ) ENGINE=InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT=2265 DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1;

table.name: encounters
table.column: Voce acordou em uma camera da Crio-Sono.

Voce acorda desorientado, caiu sobre a base de uma vagem de Crio-Sono vazia, ainda umida de fluidos da Crio-Sono. A poeira espessa do chao se agarra a sua pele, limpando um pouco o chao, onde um grande "05" esta pintado.
Do outro lado da sala, ha uma porta aberta para o corredor, e uma janela quebrada levando para fora.
Assim como voce recobra a sua inteligencia, um grito sobrenatural entra em erupcao pelo corredor alem da entrada. Algo esta chegando. Rapido....

table.name: encounters
table.column: Hackear a porta para que ela se feche.

Usando um codigo comum de substituicao de manutencao, voce alterna os controles da porta para o modo de manutencao, forcando a porta fechada e ficar bloqueada. A criatura uiva loucamente, bate na porta e encaminha algumas vezes, antes que seus sons abafados recuem de novo.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Uma planta chama sua atencao quando voce digitaliza a sala para obter suprimentos. Ricinus communis, oque fabrica de oleo de mamona, esta crescendo na janela. Voce lembra que esta planta pode ser altamente toxica, e a maioria dos animais evitara, se possivel.
Rompendo alguns ramos, voce pisa rapidamente as folhas e as sementes, esfregando os fragmentos nos pes e nas maos. Voce espalhou o resto na entrada apenas a tempo.
A criatura predadora de um tipo de cachorro, para quando atinge a entrada, cheirando as plantas e sacudindo a cabeca com desgosto. Voce empurre suas maos em direcao a ele, e volta para tras, obviamente desinteressado em seu cheiro toxico.
Com mais um suspiro, ele penetra no corredor, procurando presas mais palataveis.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
There is a sudden roar, and a rush of dry air, as blinding, blue-white light bathes the area.
Formless darkness begins to appear from within, and soon, it emerges: an impenetrably black silhouette, endlessly casting off fragments of itself. Orange burns from its center, pierced by the scattering fragments of black.
It's already moving by the time you can resolve its shape, and its crude, chalk-white face is fixed on you.

table.name: encounters
table.column: O Lobisomem esta morto, agora o que?

Com a adrenalina baixando, voce volta sua atencao para essa sala estranha.
Voce provavelmente deveria sair daqui, caso existam mais dessas coisas.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Despejar conteudo de um tanque no chao(fluido sub-congelante).

Com o painel de controle, voce chama um codigo de evacuacao de estase de emergencia. Fazer isso ira substituir o procedimento normal de descongelamento e despejar o conteudo de um tanque inteiro no chao instantaneamente.
A pressa do fluido sub-congelante pode assustar o monstro. E talvez o monstro acabe dormindo ao ivez de voce.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Encontrar algum lugar para se esconder.

Voce rapidamente escaneia a sala a procura de um esconderijo e encontra um atras do tanque Crio-Sono mais proximo da janela. Espero que a luz do exterior ajude e torne mais dificil ve-lo nas sombras proximas. E com a maioria do lugar cheirando ao liquido do Crio-Sono, voce tem uma otima chance de ter seu aroma mascarado.
Voce prende a respiracao enquanto algo entra na sala. A criatura chega com sua respiracao pesada, e com o tempo torna-se mais calma quando comeca a cheirar o ar. O cheiro se aproxima, mas continua mais na sala. Ele solta um resmungo irritado, e comeca a cheirar de volta ao corredor.
Alguns minutos depois, voce tem certeza de que a criatura esta fora do alcance dos seus ouvido novamente.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The house takes on a different character through the eyes of the sack. The burlap is abrasive and uncomfortable, but somehow makes the house feel more peaceful.
You open the door, and find the hall mercifully quiet, with nothing but unmoving corpses. You start to wonder if you'll be able to handle going back outside, with all the rasping noises of breathing life.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You recall that standard practice is to have a crash kit nearby in facilities like this, and check for emergency cabinets around the room.
Sure enough, there's a cabinet just by the door, and it still has a medical kit in it!

table.name: encounters
table.column: Rig the door to stay shut.

Using a common maintenance override code, you switch the door controls into maintenance mode, forcing the door closed and locked. The creature howls madly, slams into the door, and rams it a few times, before its muffled sounds recede again.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You decide to make a break for it, and dive through the broken window. Glass rakes your skin, and you stumble on an overgrown hedge. You recover, and start sprinting away from the building. No looking back. Just running to put distance between you and whatever that thing was.
After a while, though, you start to notice the chill in the air, the discomfort of running barefoot, and the frustration at being unable to remember much of anything: who you are, why you were in cryo sleep, where you are. You're going to need some answers.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
One or more creatures approach, but none have seen you yet.
Will you sneak closer to them?
Or keep your distance?

table.name: encounters
table.column: Fechar a porta com seus conhecimentos de Eletricista.

Usando um codigo comum de substituicao de manutencao, voce alterna os controles da porta para o modo de manutencao, forcando a porta a se fechar. A criatura uiva loucamente, bate na porta e a forcando algumas vezes, e depois de um tempo seus sons abafados recuam.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
A poeira no chao facilita o seu olho treinado para escolher um conjunto de faixas em particular.
Eles parecem pertencer a um humano arrastando algo, provavelmente um manto ou capa. Os rastros sao bastante recente, provavelmente nas ultimas 24 horas. Entrou atraves da entrada, caminhou ate o tanque de estase, foi ao console de controle e depois saiu.
Voce apostaria um bom dinheiro, para dizer que nao era o Lobisomem que voce acabou de enfrentar.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Dentro da Cryo-Facility com Lobisomem morto.
Voce esta em uma sala de de cryostasis. Porem parece que voce tenha sido o unico sobrevivente.

table.name: encounters
table.column: You decide that was so awesome that you fish through the console for the security footage of it, and take it.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Something catches your eye as you scan the room. Obscured in the shadows behind tank #2 is something small and metallic lying on the floor.
Upon closer inspection, it appears to be a multitool pocket knife. Probably left behind by maintenance personnel ages ago, and nobody saw it since.
Whoever left it here, you're pretty sure they don't need it as much as you, so you decide to take it.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Voce decide sair e ver se consegue descobrir onde voce esta.
Evitando o vidro quebrado, voce pisa no peitoril e sai para fora, abrindo caminho pelas plantas voce ve que esta crescendo varias plantas selvagens na area. E legal la fora um pouco e umido. Provavelmente e de manha.
Voce ouve bem distante um tiro de uma arma que chama sua atencao. Voce vira sua cabeca, mas o som acabou tao rapido.
Obviamente voce nao esta sozinho aqui. Embora isso nao necessariamente o conforte.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Punching in the code for the celebrity, you rush back to your own tube, and re-seal it.
Tank #1 starts to hum, and the seal breaks with a roaring rush of fluid. The room squeals and flexes with the chilling cold of the liquid nitrogen covering the floor.
Within moments, the nitrogen has boiled off at room temperature, leaving a frozen mansicle on the floor.
Initially, the dogman backs off, unsure of the commotion that just occurred. However, hunger quickly replaces concern, as the smell of thawing flesh catches his attention. He starts dragging the body off, probably to his lair.
And his career was just warming up...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You sprint to the window and dive through, avoiding broken glass and even clearing an overgrown hedge on the other side. Rolling to break the fall, you start sprinting away from the building. No looking back. Just running to put distance between you and whatever that thing was. You're not even sure it had a chance to see you, you moved so fast.
After a while, though, you start to notice the chill in the air, the discomfort of running barefoot, and the frustration at being unable to remember much of anything: who you are, why you were in cryo sleep, where you are. You're going to need some answers.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You drop to a defensive stance as it bursts into the room. The beast stands on its hind legs like a man, but has the appearance of a ragged, predatory dog.
The combination of your stance and build must really look imposing, because the dogman actually looks a bit confused when it sees you, and hesitates.
You both lunge at each other, colliding with great force. The dogman realizes its error too late, as you slam it against the door jamb. Repeatedly.
Its corpse crumpled at your feet, you let loose with an unbridled roar that echoes down the facility's halls.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
As night falls, you notice there is a bright glow coming from the east, easily visible through the treetops. It's no guarantee, but it could be a sign of civilization. Maybe even a lead on where you are, or who.
And if nothing else, it's as good a landmark to strike towards as any.
(Press "Minimap" or the "M" key to see its location on the map.)

table.name: encounters
table.column: Procurou no console para obter registros.

Voce verifica o console, em busca das informacoes dos pacientes, e encontra tres registros:
Tank #1: Anton Blubber Committed 2012-11-11 Emergency contact: Angela Blubber, 45 Campbell St., Detroit, MI, 48210 Billing info: Angela Blubber, 45 Campbell St., Detroit, MI, 48210
Tank #5: Philip Kindred Committed 2019-09-15 **NO DATA** Billing info: Account #20141117 Detroit Savings Bank
Tank #6: Lloyd Blankcheck Committed 2008-10-18 Emergency contact: Meyer & Meyer LLP, 304 South Broadway, Detroit, MI, 48226 Billing info: Meyer & Meyer LLP, 304 South Broadway, Detroit, MI, 48226

table.name: encounters
table.column: You try to get as close as possible without revealing yourself...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Navigating the twisty maze of shacks and tarp shelters, Detroit's massive walls stand as a constant backdrop to the east.
Easily half a dozen stories high, and probably almost as thick, the city walls are an impressive sight to behold. Armed towers, bristling with surveillance arrays, stand at regular intervals, keeping watch over the Sprawl, and likely the city within.
Before you, giant vidscreens on the three gatehouses flash instructions about pass requirements and threat levels, as flocks of people stream into and out of the gates.
You take your place in line on the right, with the others entering the city.

table.name: encounters
table.column: First Visit to the House at Seven Gables Road

As you make your way down old Seven Gables Road, you feel a growing sense of unease. There's an unnatural silence here, except for the whispering of air moving through branches bare of all but a few dead leaves. Your footsteps are impossibly loud on the waterlogged bed of reeds and leaves, announcing your presence.
Ahead, you can see the silhouette of the house: dark, lonely, and in disrepair. The old split-level looks like it may have been a home for a family once, judging by the rusty swingset.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
As the elevator cage slows to a stop, you see Hatter through the iron lattice, writing something on a sheet of plastic. He holds it up to an attending runner, who then hurries to catch the elevator before it's recalled.
"Data runners," he says, wiping the plastic clean as you approach. "Network's pretty spotty out here, even this close to the DMC. Besides, " he puts the blank plastic back into a drawer, "media diversity makes for more security."
He rests his forearms on the desk. "So, you have a delivery for me?"

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Back outside, you cross the muddy square, and stop to survey the area. Where do you go now? Would anyone in the Sprawl know about the cryo facility?
You're startled when you notice a man has been watching you. He's wearing a long brown coat and matching hat and is leaning on a walking stick. From this distance, you can almost see the glint of his eyes below the trilby's brim, though it's probably just your imagination.
He takes his time approaching you, and as he nears, you notice there's heavy maquillage on his face. It reminds you of one of those old portraits you'd see in a history textbook.
"Folks call me Hatter," he says matter-of-factly. "I think we may be able to help each other. Come with me."

table.name: encounters
table.column:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.
"Visitor Pass N6MAA10816 Authorized."
The guard ushers you forward, and you begin down a long-ish stretch of empty corridor lined with harsh xenon lighting.
Beyond the opening at the other end, you see throngs of activity and the flicker of busy signage eclipsed by passing people.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
"It hardly seems worth the fuss," Hatter says as you hand him the urn. "I'd almost forgo my end of the payment to know the story behind it."
He places the urn in a safe, then locks it. "But it's not worth the hit to my reputation."
He reaches into a desk drawer, and produces a black wristband. "As agreed, your visitor's pass."
As you ride the elevator car down through the building's innards once again, you wonder what to expect beyond DMC's massive gates.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Hatter's demeanor cools. "That's disappointing."
He begins attending to other tasks. "I'll make this clear, for my sake, as well as yours." The elevator begins humming up the shaft again.
"You needn't return here again without completing your contract." The clatter of the elevator's cage seems to punctuate his point. "That is all. Good day."

table.name: encounters
table.column:
When you reach the front of the line, a sinking feeling overcomes you. Heavily armed guards in full combat armor are checking attendees with some sort of scanning device. You're pretty sure that whatever these other folks have to get in, you're missing it.
When it's your turn, the guard stops you, and turns to a monitor installed in the wall. A message reads "Device not detected. Entrance denied."
With the efficiency and compassion of an assembly line worker, he directs you away from the line, back outside. Unfortunately, getting entrance to the city may be trickier than just showing up.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
"Has our situation improved?" Hatter's voice sounds tinny through the intercom. Obviously unimpressing him with your last visit, you're forced to state your case from the dampness outdoors this time.
The guard stares impatiently at you, his thumb on the "Talk" button.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Inside, under pale lighting, you're made to wait in restraints for hours. Drab cubicles divide most of the floor, and stern-looking operatives variously interview detainees, check computers, and disappear into other cubicles.
Your eyes mine every detail of the room, looking for anything interesting to settle on. White foam ceiling tiles, beige filing cabinets, black inbox/outbox trays, pine desktops...it's so sterile that it actually incites frustration.
Helpfully, informational posters and propaganda seem to be hung on display to add a splash of color. "DMC Perimeter Services: We Care!" and "Contraband: It hurts all of us."
The "Missing Persons" touchscreen was good for about an hour, but you've memorized all the faces by now.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.
When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.
"You have been charged as follows: -Fraud and misuse of visas -Conspiracy to defraud the city of Detroit -Consorting with a known felon -Failure to disclose personal information"

table.name: encounters
table.column:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.
"Visitor Pass N6MAC41717 Flagged: Detain for Questioning."
Your gut suddenly feels like a vacuum. The guard places a heavy-gloved hand on your shoulder. "Alright, buddy, let's go."
You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
By the time your case handler arrives, you've counted the ceiling tiles, grouped them into shades of beige, and created an elaborate conspiracy linking all the missing persons.
Your handler leads you to his cubicle, and you're subjected to a battery of tests, including face scan, retinal scan, DNA sampling, fingerprinting, and a blood sample.
The interview is something of a comedy, with questions like "What is your full name, address, and date of birth?"
And when asked where you obtained the forged pass, your answer is received less than enthusiastically.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Roof collapse!
The unstable ruins start falling as a result of your rummaging, and a portion of the roof collapses. You are cut and bruised by the falling debris.

table.name: encounters
table.column: You decide to not try scavenging for now.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Olhando ao seu redor, parece haver algumas areas que merecem ser vasculhadas.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You fell down a ravine!
While trying to navigate a precarious ravine, you slip and tumble to the bottom. In the fall, you get banged up and bruised, but thankfully nothing more serious.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Booby trap!
You spring a hidden trap while trying to enter, and it opens a gash in your skin. You're lucky it didn't do worse.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You decide to check out a crumbling apartment building. It's a mess inside: broken bricks lay in piles, bits of glass strewn everywhere like glittering dust, water stains and dead leaves litter the outer edges of the building, and rock dust still covers areas sheltered from the elements.
Scavengers before you have obviously picked most of the easy scores clean, but a little elbow grease and some risk-taking might reward the intrepid treasure-seeker.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Use caution to avoid attracting attention while scavenging.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Use some muscle to move debris around and look for better loot.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Use night vision to see in dark areas.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Use a crowbar to pry barriers loose during scavenging.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
This concrete apartment building looks to be in better shape than most. Sure, the windows are all but gone and a giant fissure runs along one wall, but this place looks as if it could still provide suitable shelter for someone.
Perhaps that's what makes you feel so nervous about approaching it.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The suburbs were hit hard in the collapse. With masses of people fleeing urban centers in search of supplies, and supernatural threats encroaching from the wilds, the suburbs became the front lines in a war for survival.
Still, houses like these are so numerous that some have been entirely missed by scavengers. And they tend to be less likely to fall over than the bigger buildings in urban centers.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Like other suburban homes, mobile homes were on the front lines in a war between fleeing urban populations and supernatural hordes from the wilds. However, their smaller size often means there's less to be found in each.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Due to their nature, office towers weren't primary looting targets during the food riots. More obvious targets got the most attention.
Later on, astute scavengers realized many offices had bottled water, and often kitchens. What's more, the supply closets often contained valuable survival tools. The supplies aren't expected to be great, but it's worth a shot.

table.name: encounters
table.column: This office building is in ruins, and it's unlikely much survived its collapse. The creaking walls and ceiling are no boost to your confidence, either. Still, that may mean no one was brave enough (or perhaps desperate enough) to go in there.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
This stretch of forest seems to almost flourish in the absence of human life. There's a good chance one could find food and raw materials in here if they knew what to look for.
Just watch out for creatures that make this forest their home...and hunting ground.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Being far removed from urban centers, this secluded shack may have more promise. However, it could also be the home of a survivalist or militia member, so beware of booby traps.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Open fields are scavengers' worst options, as anything of value here was likely already spotted and taken. Plus, there's hardly anywhere to hide.
But hey, beggars can't be choosers.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Os galpoes de armazenamento tem otimos itens. Ostensivelmente deve haver alguns bens dentro. Mas, novamente, qualquer um aqui antes que voce conhecesse isso e limpou-o. Ainda assim, vale a pena vasculhar.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Use knowledge of plants to find better plant-based loot.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Pick the locks on the shed.

Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.
Now, let's see what's in here...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Apesar de sua aparencia de alta tecnologia, esta instalacao parece estar bem escondida na regiao selvagem, e esta fora da de vista.
Isso e um bom pressagio para as chances de encontrar algo de valor, ou mesmo de um abrigo, desde que ninguem tenha configurado um acampamento aqui ou teve a mesmas ideia.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Keep an eye out for traps.
Use your knowledge of trapping to look for signs of a trap, and bypass it.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Force your way past the lock.

Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.
Now, let's see what's in here...

table.name: encounters
table.column: Use lockpicking on any locks you encounter while scavenging.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The Junk Market
As you navigate the winding alleys of DMC's Sprawl, you encounter a huge structure fashioned of shipping containers. Throngs of people enter and exit the structure through a doorway on one side.
Inside, you can see a thriving bazaar where people trade scavenged items in the light of a thousand lanterns and bug zappers. The air is thick with sweat, smoke, and the smell of barbecue and spices.
This is the Sprawl's notorious Junk Market.
Pick up items to purchase them, or drop items to sell them.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The dust on the ground makes it easy for your trained eye to pick out one set of tracks in particular.
They seem to belong to a humanoid dragging something, probably a mantle or cloak. It was here fairly recently, probably in the past 24 hours. It entered through the doorway, walked to your stasis tank, went to the control console, and then left.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
A medida que voce se aproxima da cidade, nao ha sinal de atividade. Os edificios estao em ruina. Os veiculos estao tombados e enegrecidos com fogo. As marcas de explosao irradiam para fora das paredes e do pavimento.
A distancia, criaturas de aparencia estranha circundam o ceu, como abutres monstruosos e feios.
O mundo mudou drasticamente ate onde voce saiba. Algum tipo de cataclisma ocorreu sobre a Terra, retornando a humanidade as eras das trevas.
E junto com isso, suas esperancas de encontrar uma refeicao quente e algumas respostas. Voce decide olhar ao redor, e descobrir o que pode das ruinas.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The distant report of a gun disrupts your thoughts. You cock your head, listening, but it's over as quickly as it started.
Obviously, you're not alone out here. Though that doesn't necessarily comfort you.
Taking a look around you, you decide to start searching for some answers, not to mention supplies.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Para vasculhar um hexadecimal, primeiro voce deve escolher um local para a pesquisa. Alguns hexagonos tem apenas um local, mas outros podem ter mais.
Entao, sera mostrado o sucesso relativo de sua busca e os niveis de seguranca do processo da sua vasculha. Voce tambem pode fazer uso das ferramentas e habilidades para ajustar os resultados.
As barras verdes/cheias sao boas, as barras vermelhas/vazias sao ruins.
Loot: Possibilidade de encontrar loot ou um acampamento. Safety(Seguranca): Possibilidade de evitar um acidente. Sneak: Possibilidade de vasculhar sem atrair a atencao.
Escolha suas opcoes com cuidado!

table.name: encounters
table.column:
As you step into a clearing, you finally see the source of that eastern glow: it's a city, larger than any you've ever seen.
Skyscrapers, and their bigger brothers, arcologies, stand shoulder-to-shoulder, casting their glittering lights into the sky. Hovering lights flit around the supertowers like fireflies. A massive wall encircles their base, with armed buttresses like glowing points on a crown.
And radiating out from that wall, a shanty town of crumbling buildings, shacks, and tarp lean-tos.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Use a squirrel snare to catch squirrels.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Hatter's office is in the husk of one of those flophouse hotels you'd see crammed between high-rises in a busy city. It even has the old marquee, hanging precariously from the cornerstones. Several floors up, armed guards watch over the street from missing sections of the building.
Hatter acknowledges the men at the door, and leads you through a surprisingly clean lobby to an old-fashioned elevator.
"I have a client," he starts, pausing for the cage to rattle shut, "who collects heirlooms." He speaks louder, over the motor, "He compensates well. Well-enough, in fact, that I'd be willing to part with a DMC visitor's pass in exchange."
The elevator clunks to a halt, and the door rattles open, revealing a dark room lit by video screens and old lamps.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Stepping off the elevator, it feels like you've walked into a control center built into an antique store. Baubles and relics crowd the walls and tabletops, while video screens and computer consoles cast a bluish tint on a handful of armed guards.
Hatter crosses the room to sit at a low, broad desk, facing the elevator. "There's a lake," he pulls a worn road atlas from a desk drawer, "about a day's walk northwest of here."
"Inside a building there is a silver urn." He pages through the atlas to a map of Michigan. "My guess is that you know a thing or two about getting around out there, and maybe this could be your ticket into the DMC."
He pauses to look up at you. "Interested?"

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Hatter slots the memory stick into one of his video monitors. As the footage plays out on Hatter's wall unit, you notice more than one bodyguard shift self-consciously, and another utters a low whistle. Hatter's lips curl into genuine satisfaction, and he leans back in his creaky, wooden chair.
"Maybe Christmas comes early this year. Tell you what, forget about the urn. The pass is yours."
He pulls a black wristband from a desk drawer, and extends it to you over the desk.
"And hey," he says before letting go of it, "maybe you come around again when you're looking for some work. I think a few of these hotshots could learn a thing or two."

table.name: encounters
table.column: Ask about the odd tracks on the ground.

Though the floor here has a lot of distracting marks, there is one set of tracks that stands out from the regular foot traffic.
A humanoid dragging something, probably a mantle or cloak, has recently obscured much of the older markings on the old floor here.
"A lot of your clients dress like the Grim Reaper?" you ask.
Hatter stops immediately, tilting his head just enough to peer at you from under his brim.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
"Glad to hear it," he says.
He spreads the map of Michigan out on the desk, and motions for you to come closer.
"The urn is in a shack near Hidden Lake, out on old Seven Gables Road." He points out the location to you on the map.
"You bring me that urn, and the visitor's pass is yours."

table.name: encounters
table.column: "So, what'll it be?" Hatter says, picking up a jerry-rigged pocket computer, and thumbing through some list as he waits.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
"Very well." He turns to one of the guards, "Please see our client out."
As the guard slides the elevator cage shut, Hatter calls after you. "If you should change your mind, you know where to find me."
A moment later, you are standing back outside, in the muddy alleys of the Sprawl.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Negotiate a trade for a security upgrade instead.

Not thrilled about the sounds of that urn job, you try to come up with another proposal. Noticing that Hatter's security system has some older-style, high-wattage monitors, an idea occurs to you.
You mention that you've seen a few iSlabs with LCD screens out in the wastes, and maybe you could rig a few up to replace the power hogs he has now. The image would be clearer, and it'd pull less from his generators.
Hatter sits back for a few seconds, and contemplates. He starts nodding, "I think that'll work." He leans forward again. "You have yourself a deal. Install 3 of those iSlabs for me, and you have yourself a visitor's pass."

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Something doesn't add up. You're no seasoned mercenary, but you're sure any fixer worth his salt is going to be careful with whom he contracts for work. And a visitor's pass can't be cheap, so there's no way this is just a cakewalk test.
Plus, Hatter approached *you*. Nobody walks into a town out of nowhere and gets that kind of welcome. Something doesn't wash here, and it's making you edgy.
"I don't like this," you say, stopping short of sounding threatening. "Sounds like someone's trying to set me up."
That gets Hatter's attention. You hear the creak of leather as a guard tenses.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
"Hm," he says, leaning back in his creaky chair. "Turns out maybe you *are* worth the extra attention you seem to have garnered."
He looks down at a blank spot on his desk, considering something a moment, and starts talking at it. "Your 'Reaper', as you call him, had a particular interest in you."
He leans forward, and starts interacting with his security console. "Interested enough to open this urn contract with express instructions that it only be assigned to you. Said I'd find you trying to enter the DMC. Said he'd front the cost of the visitor's pass if I got you to do it."
He finishes a keystroke, then gestures to the wall monitors.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
One of the monitors switches to a view of this room, with a cycling timecode in the lower corner. After a few seconds of fast-forwarding, it switches to real-time playback.
There, standing where you are now, a black mass about the size of a man talks with Hatter. The detail seems to be glitchy, as if there were some dark-colored static distorting the signal, but only around the figure.
"What's with the censoring?" you ask.
"Dunno," he says. "Looked normal in-person. Must be some sort of EM interference."
The discussion is short, punctuated by the figure handing Hatter a small object, then leaving.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
"As a rule, I don't disclose client info like this." He stops the video. "But you seem like a decent type. More to the point, resourceful. And while money talks, I'll take a competent operative over cash any day."
He reaches into a drawer, and pulls out a small, black wristband. "The pass is yours. I'll keep my ear to the ground for any info on this reaper fellow, and let you know."
"And hey," he says before letting go of it, "maybe you come around again when you're looking for some work."

table.name: encounters
table.column:
As you approach the house, you realize the place has been barricaded from the inside. Someone has hastily nailed boards across the windows on both floors, and stacked, heavy objects are visible through the broken doors.
Someone was afraid of something either inside or outside that house. Not knowing which was the case only makes you more uneasy.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Enter the house at Seven Gables.

You climb the few steps to the front door, and realize it's been forced open just enough to let a person through.
Taking a deep breath, you gather your courage and press through.
Instantly upon entering, a sense of dread overcomes you. You definitely feel a malevolent presence, and worse, you feel it knows you're here.
You're on a landing between floors, and stairs go to the main floor on your left, and to the basement on your right.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Climbing over debris up the stairs, you reach a T intersection, with the living room opening up to your right. There is a musty smell up here, with a faint, sickening sweetness.
Across the living room, you see a hutch surrounded by broken dishes. And atop it, a silver urn.
You cross the moldy room to the hutch, retrieve the urn, and look closely at it. It's then that you suddenly feel vulnerable, like your back is exposed. You feel several tremors, like someone is crossing the floor rapidly behind you, startling you into turning around.
To see four upright corpses. Down the hall, past the stairway, four corpses hang in nooses from the ceiling, each in a state of decay.
And the one closest to you hasn't been here long.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
"That's more like it," the crackling intercom says in its tinny timbre.
The guard opens the door, and you're again riding the metal cage up through the old building.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
As you begin descending the steps, you hear noises in the basement, like things are being thrown around. They culminate in a chest-rattling "boom!" from the room on the right as you reach the bottom. You freeze, listening to the creaking of the house from the tremor. A dented dryer still wobbles at the far side of the cellar, but the only noises now are a faint, rhythmic creaking from the upstairs hallway.
Checking through the dryer husk and the few waterlogged boxes, there doesn't appear to be anything of value. You turn back towards the stairs, but stop cold when you see a silhouette beyond the stairway, facing you.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You reach the barricaded front door, and start squeezing your way back outside. You're caught, though, and as you struggle, you hear clamoring on the stairs behind you.
Too narrow to turn and see what it is, you push more frantically to get through. Icy fingers scrabble at your back, burning you with cold, as you finally unwedge yourself and stumble down the steps, onto wet, peaty ground.
The house lies quiet behind you, no sign of anything beyond the door. The chills on your back ache, they're so intense.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You stare at the corpses for a few moments, watching carefully for movement. None move, though, not even twisting on the ropes. Whatever made that tremor near you wasn't them.
Then, a damp breath strikes your face, like something standing directly in front of you just exhaled.
You recoil instinctively and bang against the hutch behind you, suddenly aware of an invisible presence facing you.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Downstairs, you keep a vigilant eye out for whatever haunts this place, but don't see anything. However, you get a strong feeling that it is still here.
Worse, you feel *very* unwelcome. As you look around the basement, you hear items start to shift and bump. The scraping of cardboard on concrete causes you to turn, too late to duck a flying box.
Something else strikes you in the back of your head. Whatever is down here is not messing around.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
After failing Hatter a second time, it seems he's wasting no more time than necessary on you.
Idle static plays a few moments more over the intercom, then the harsh click of disconnection. The guard then moves to block the door, and looks out over the street as if you're not there.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Installing the iSlabs turns out to be pretty easy. You end up having to bypass the battery circuit and adapt the video signal cables, but Hatter is more than happy to let you use spare parts from old equipment he's collected.
When finished, you climb down from the paisley footstool you borrowed, and the two of you survey your work.
"You're a handy one," he admits, a bit of surprise in his voice. "I believe that means I owe you something." He heads back to his desk, opening a drawer.
"Your visitor's pass," he says, extending a black wristband.
As you make your way back to the elevator, you hear the grunt of a guard lifting one of the old 21-inch monitors.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You've reached the edge of the NEO Scavenger demo!
What happens next? What adventure awaits in the wastelands beyond? What other places are there to explore? To find out, consider supporting NEO Scavenger by purchasing it at Blue Bottle Games (www.bluebottlegames.com)!
Want to explore the demo some more instead? Choose the "Return to demo" response below to be returned to the demo. You can continue playing it as long as you want!

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You have decided to keep playing the demo.
Don't forget, lots of cool stuff await in the paid version! -Save your game, keep your progress! -Experience more encounters! -Gain access to Detroit Mega City! -Discover more items, weapons, and recipes! -Enjoy an in-game soundtrack!
Visit Blue Bottle Games at bluebottlegames.com to learn more!

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Congratulations, you have taken the first step towards supporting NEO Scavenger! Looking forward to seeing you inside!
(Note: pop-up blockers might prevent a new browser window from opening. If so, type:
bluebottlegames.com
in your browser to go there manually.)

table.name: encounters
table.column:
On the muddy street outside Hatter's office, a metallic buzz sounds as the door locks click open. You step into the iron cage of the elevator.
The humming car carries you to Hatter's floor, and you find him removing a file from his desk.
"Reconsidered the urn job?" he says, looking up at you from the folder's contents.

table.name: encounters
table.column: You decide not to enter the house after all.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You're not really sure why you're getting back in this line, after all that's happened. It's not like your sentence is up, and you're pretty sure their computer doesn't have faulty memory. Still, maybe there's a chance you'll slip through.
At the front of the line, you're made to stop and submit to a scan. The monitor flashes.
"Exile N6MAA64843 Denied"
"You kidding me?" the guard asks, incredulous. He pulls you to the side. "Don't you...?"
Then, he pushes you away from the gate. "You're just making it worse, you know!"
His frustration spills over to the next guy, who casts a scowl your way.
So much for that idea.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Busted knuckles.
While forcing open a promising-looking container, your hand slips, leaving you with a sore hand.
It's nothing serious, but it has hampered your scavenging efforts for now.

table.name: encounters
table.column: You decide not to try scavenging for now.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Stuck in an opening.
While trying to access a blocked room, you get stuck crawling through an opening in the debris.
You manage to wriggle free again, but you lost quite a bit of time in the ordeal.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Rotted floorboard.
Your foot slips through a rotting floorboard, causing you to trip.
The scrapes and bruises will sting for a while, but thankfully it wasn't more serious.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Cut on some broken glass.
It was a stupid mistake, but while trying to reach a blocked room from the outside, you cut yourself on the broken glass from the window.
It'll sting for a while, but it isn't anything serious.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Slipped on a rock.
While navigating some broken, mossy terrain, you slip and land on the wet stone.
While a painful setback, you're thankful it wasn't worse.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Slipped down a slope.
While ascending a steep slope, you lose your footing, slipping most of the way to the bottom.
It bruised you a bit, but thankfully the worst of it is lost progress.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Voce instintivamente deixa uma posicao defensiva quando explode na sala.
O animal esta em suas pernas traseiras como um homem, mas tem a aparencia de um cao rabugento e predatorio. Parece certo e grita com um som que congela seu sangue.
Apesar do seu medo, voce faz uma boa luta. Voce se move como se tivesse feito isso antes, e evite a maior parte de seus ataques. Voce ate conseguiu dar um golpe que envia o animal cambaleando.
Aproveitando sua distracao, voce o mata no chao com um golpe fatal com seu joelho.
Embora esteja ferido, pelo menos voce esta vivo.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Voce acelera seus nervos, e decide tirar essa coisa, seja la o que for. Quando voce assume uma posicao defensiva, ele explode na sala.
O animal esta em suas pernas traseiras como um homem, mas tem a aparencia de um cao rabugento e predatorio. Aparece direto para voce, gritos e atacando.
Ele se choca com uma forca que igual a sua, e o Lobisomem realmente tem que voltar para manter seu equilibrio.
Aproveitando sua distracao, voce bateu no chao e pega sua garganta. Suas garras rasgam sua carne enquanto esmagam sua traqueia com cada grama de forca que voc tem.
Momentos depois, ele para de se mecher. Voce percebe que isso lhe custou feridas desagradaveis, mas pelo menos voce esta vivo.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Use some muscle to move rocks and plants around and look for better loot.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You peer into the basement. Without warning, your body is thrown down the hall, colliding against the concrete. You collapse in a heap, ears ringing from the impact, and immediately feel something constrict about your neck.
Your hands reach toward your neck, but you are violently thrown against the ceiling, and the last thing you hear is a wet snap as your body jolts on a noose mid-fall...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Deciding to bring technology to bear on this problem, you switch your night vision on.
As the image through the goggles resolves, you realize there are dozens of corpses around you, standing upright. Their necks swollen and faces drawn, they turn in unison to face you, a sea of cavernous eyes.
Their expressions slowly transform to fear, mouths gaping, and bright lights come from within. Your field of view turns white with glare as fat, cold hands grip your throat.
You try to wrench free, clawing at both the goggles and your neck. The grip tightens, lifting you and smashing your head against the rafters. The goggles go dark, malfunctioning, and you fall suddenly before a sharp snap ends it all...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You decide to check upstairs again, to see if you missed anything.
Skulking up the front stairs, you see the familiar, musty living room from which you saw the urn. Reaching the top, you turn left into the hall with the hanging corpses.
Except that they're gone.
A moment of paralysis seizes you as your head tries to make sense of the empty hallway, and then it returns: the feeling that you are exposed.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Scrambling to move, you bounce off the unseen force, half-running, half-crawling to the stairs, like some crazed three-legged animal.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Propelled by a wave of fear, you push off the hutch and bounce off the unseen force, spinning and stumbling towards the stairs.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Paralyzed with fear, you stare ahead in disbelief, unable to see the thing you feel directly in front of you.
Then, your feet are violently pulled from beneath you, sending you to the floor, your cheekbone banging painfully on broken dishes and rotting pile carpet. You claw in desperation as you're dragged at alarming speed down the hall, into the darkness...

table.name: encounters
table.column: Run down the hall, towards the corpses!

In a panic, you glance off the unseen force in front of you and barrel down the hall. Limbs from the corpses seem to cling to you as you pass, sending painful chills down your back.
As you approach the end of the darkened hallway, there is a doorway on the right.
You have no idea how close that thing is to you. You wouldn't even see it if you turned around anyway.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Without warning, your body is thrown down the hall, colliding with the cheap brass sconce at the end. You collapse in a heap, and immediately feel something constrict around your neck.
Your hands reach toward your neck, but you are violently thrown against the ceiling, and the last thing you hear is a wet snap as your body jolts on a noose mid-fall...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Dead end.
You burst into the room, and stumble on piles of twisted rags and cardboard. Unfortunately, the only other exit is a window with a sheet of sturdy plywood over it, studded with countless nails.
Your feet are ripped from beneath you, burying your face in fetid blankets. A heavy weight slams against your back, pinning you to the floor as something works its way around your neck.
It tightens with alarming force, yanking you up from the floor, and suspending you, swinging. Your eyes feel as if they'll burst from the constriction, and then nothing...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You barrel into the room, and the door claps firmly shut behind you.
The feeling of malevolence strikes you first, like you're in plain sight of a predator.
A corpse is slumped over on a dilapidated bed, facing the door you just came through. There is a shadow of fine soil around it, where flesh has fallen off and rotted on the old sheets, and a burlap sack over its head.
Beyond it, on the opposite wall, is a window shrouded in cheap faded curtains and criss-crossed by planks of wood.
Nothing moves, however, and the stillness is almost more unnerving than the alternative.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You break for the window, and grasp one of the boards.
Trying to yank the board free, the door flies open with a hollow roar. Fear burns your back as you dislodge the plank.
You throw the plank aside, and dive through the window. A moment of rushing air and sparkling glass passes, and then you land- hard- on rotting wood and reeds.
Your sinuses and mouth tingle, and your vision shrinks to a tunnel-like spot from the pain...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Steeling your nerves, you tentatively reach for the burlap sack over the corpse's head. Though it looks tightly wound around his neck, it comes off with relative ease.
The head beneath is a hideous sight to behold, with uneven rot where the sack touched the flesh.
The sack itself is rough, dry, and has eye holes cut into it. Thick twine is threaded through the opening like a drawstring.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You reach for the doorknob, and it is ice-cold. Gritting your teeth against the pain, you turn and pull.
Before the door is completely open, something invisible seizes your throat, and pulls you into the hallway like a ragdoll.
The force winds around your neck, making your eyes go bleary with pressure, and you're flung against the ceiling. Your fall is broken by a sharp yank tightening your neck, and your vision explodes with a pattern before going dark...

table.name: encounters
table.column: Revisiting the House at Seven Gables Road, Wearing Hood
As you make your way down old Seven Gables Road, the house seems less forbidding. It almost seems welcoming, as if it offers an oasis of quiet among the wretched, screeching noises of the living.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Enter the house at Seven Gables.
You're on a landing between floors, and stairs go to the main floor on your left, and to the basement on your right.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Apart from the sack, there appears to be little else remarkable about the corpse.
You decide to leave it be.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Climbing over debris up the stairs, you reach a T intersection, with the living room opening up to your right. There is a familiar smell up here, which is comforting.
There is little else to do up here, though, so after looking the room over, you decide to move on.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The basement offers a welcome shelter from the chittering madness of the outdoors. You feel it is also a place of punishment, where the writhing intruders are made to be quiet.
Walking down the hall, you peer into a doorway. A sweet smell penetrates your mask as you look over the sea of silent corpses. Satisfied that all is well, you return to the stairs.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Gathering your resolve, you push back outside, into the screeching, rasping world you hate so much.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
It looks as if the shadow of two eye cavities is facing you from the far wall beyond the stairs.
Your back chills at the thought of something staring at you.
Frozen in place, you strain to make out more detail, but you lose sight of it, and are left looking at a plain, painted concrete wall.
The chill subsiding, you decide to return to your search.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You start to climb the stairs again, but are violently thrown back, landing hard on the concrete basement floor.
The cracks of light from the front door disappear as you're dragged around the corner...

table.name: encounters
table.column: You start heading towards the door, but something clutches your ankle, pulling your feet from beneath you. Your face and arms scrape against stairs and concrete as you're dragged into the darkness...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You back down the stairs, and turn to face the front door. Before you can reach it, something invisible seizes your throat, and pulls you back up into the hallway like a ragdoll.
The force winds around your neck, making your eyes go bleary with pressure, and you're flung against the ceiling. Your fall is broken by a sharp yank tightening your neck, and your vision explodes with a pattern before going dark...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You turn to run, but your feet are ripped from beneath you, burying your face in moldy pile carpet. A heavy weight slams against your back, pinning you to the floor as something wraps around your neck.
It tightens with alarming force, yanking you up from the floor, and suspending you, swinging. Your eyes feel as if they'll burst from the constriction, and then nothing...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
As you pick your way through overgrown ruins, a peculiar sound becomes briefly audible. It disappears, but picks up again in a moment, as if carried by air currents.
It's a distant humming, like small gas engines, out of place in the stillness of empty forests and abandoned buildings.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
As the source of the distant sounds finally comes into view, you stop in your tracks, unsure whether it's safe to continue. Ahead, you see a titanic warehouse, like one of those distribution centers from before the apocalypse. There is a dull roar of ethanol generators, combined with the occasional rev of unsuppressed exhaust from off-road vehicles.
Figures seem to be milling around a low extension on the right, and the occasional ATV arrives or departs without fanfare. You don't think you've been spotted yet, this far out. Though with all the activity, it's hard to tell.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You cautiously approach the warehouse, noting a bright sign reading "Zom Zom's: A Place to Eat." The sign hangs over a giant garage door, which is fenced off behind tarp and barbed wire. Bright lights, welding arcs, and peculiar shadows can be seen in the fenced area, and a din of rowdy chatter echoes from within the building.
A semi-trailer attached to one of the loading bays acts as a makeshift gate and pedway into the warehouse. Ragged-looking figures line up alongside the trailer, watched over by armed mercenaries. It looks more like a club than anything else, except for that tarp area.
Just then, your stomach sinks when you realize there's a truck on the other side, offloading prisoners or slaves of some sort. Biting back panic, you reason that showing fear now might mark you as a target, and try to not break your stride. Mercifully, nobody seems to care.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Peering into the distance, you see a bright sign reading "Zom Zom's: A Place to Eat" hanging over a giant garage door, fenced off behind tarp and barbed wire. Bright lights, welding arcs, and peculiar shadows can be seen in the fenced area, and more lights from within the warehouse.
A semi-trailer attached to one of the loading bays acts as a makeshift gate and pedway into the warehouse. Ragged-looking figures line up alongside the trailer, watched over by armed mercenaries. It looks more like a club than anything else, except for that tarp area.
Then you see it: a truck on the other side, offloading prisoners or slaves of some sort. That doesn't bode well, but then again, people come and go freely everywhere else, and are entering voluntarily through the pedway.

table.name: encounters
table.column: You decide to give this place a wide berth, and continue your search elsewhere.

table.name: encounters
table.column: "Never mind," she exhales, stamping your hand with a symbol and number, and nods to another grizzly merc, who checks you for weapons. You receive a chit for your confiscated items, and are ushered down the trailer. You hear the man behind you answer "Spectator" to the attendant, before passing into a wall of sound inside the warehouse proper.

table.name: encounters
table.column: "Whatcha got?" Looking behind her, you see iSlabs, shoes, and sundry items. It looks like there are definitely some items they'll accept more than others, at least today.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
While in line, you feel a flutter of anxiety each time the line advances. With each step, you try to catch a glance of what's through the doorway in the trailer, but you still can't tell. Most of the people in line are ragtag-looking, wearing mismatched clothes, and stinking of sweat. Some confused, others bored. The guards are better-groomed, by comparison. Though you suspect they'd just as soon murder you for your clothes if they weren't being paid.
Up a few wooden plank steps, you step inside the semi-trailer, and hollow sounds of a crowd echo down the narrow corridor from the warehouse. To your right is a chipboard and mesh booth where an attendant is collecting fees and weapons and stamping people before they walk down the trailer into the warehouse.
"Stock or Spectator," the attendant drones, looking disinterestedly past you.

table.name: encounters
table.column: "Hand," she demands, reaching for a stamp as you present your hand. She applies a symbol and number, then nods to another grizzly merc, who checks you for weapons. You receive a chit for your confiscated items, and are ushered down the trailer. You hear the man behind you answer "Spectator" to the attendant, before passing into a wall of sound inside the warehouse proper.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Inside, it's one part superclub, one part gladiator pit. A wall of sound assaults your ears as you cross the threshold: part human cacophony, part generator exhaust, mostly frenetic industrial music. And the smell of food and smoke. You can't hear it over the noise, but you can feel your stomach rumble at the smell of sweet barbecue.
The cavernous warehouse is dominated by a dirt-floored arena, with high mesh walls. Spectators ring the pit on three sides, the fourth reserved for a large garage door leading outside into the tarp-fenced courtyard. Beyond the door, you catch the flash of welding arcs, where it appears scrapyard robots are being prepped.
And opposite the garage door, the thing you really care about right now: a wide booth with grills spewing sweet and spicy smoke into the rafters above. People clamor to get at it, and walk away with their prize smeared over hands and lips alike: barbecue.

table.name: encounters
table.column: You turn, and within two footfalls something collides with you, knocking you into the dirt. It has you. You can feel its grip on your arms, its weight on your back.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You wade through dirty patrons, intent on manhandling some ribs, or beans and rice, or whatever it is they've got cooking over there. Who knows how long you've been in cryo? How long it's been since you've had a hot meal?
Pressing your way through this final wall of hungry patrons, you get an elbow on the counter, and desperately try to make eye contact with one of the servers. A few eternal minutes later, one of the apron-clad food-slingers glances at you, and you nod like an excited dog. He reaches into a smoker box, withdraws a loaded skewer, and places it in your hand. Sweet, succulent barbecue.
Savoring it at first, you start to grow paranoid that it'll be snatched from your hands, and you bear down on it with renewed fervor, huddling with it against your lips as you absently walk away from the grill.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Just then, an announcer pipes up. With that same oscillating voice every strip club DJ seems to have, he starts hyping the crowd.
"Can you count, suckas!" he shouts. Patrons start yelling back. "I said, can you count, suckas!" On cue, a testosterone-fueled wave of shouts comes from the floor.
"Raise those numbers!" he calls with expectation, and everybody raises their fists in unison. The music changes, lights switch to UV, and numbers appear on all the stamped hands. Your heart starts to race, as you realize what's happening.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Looking around, everyone has a stamp, but most of them don't look like yours. Everyone has numbers, but it's clear now what the symbols are. Most patrons have silhouettes of vultures next to their numbers. You look down at your hand.
Yours is a lamb.
The announcer calls a number. A low number. You feel a bit nauseous, but also relieved. You raise your hand, nearby patrons looking suddenly, then quickly losing interest in it.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Looking around, everyone has a stamp, most like yours. They all have numbers, but it's clear now what the symbols are. Patrons like you have silhouettes of vultures next to their numbers. Those unlucky few who don't, have lambs.
The announcer calls a number. A low number.
Feeling somewhat relieved, you raise your hand above your head. Patrons around you look up to it for a moment, then continue scanning the crowd.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
A scream of protest erupts from the far side of the arena. Everyone nearby looks across, where a commotion is starting. A man is hoisted into the air, like a crowd surfer at a concert, and propelled to the arena gate. Patrons claw the remainder of his barbecue from his flailing hands, fighting over it like dogs. Guards wrangle the struggling man, and toss him onto the dirt floor in the arena as the gate is sealed behind him.
The "winner" is a filthy, weak, and confused-looking human. As he clamors to his feet, a clacking and squeaking sound crescendos from the opposite side of the arena. Cheers start erupting throughout the warehouse, as the source of the noise rolls into the arena through the garage door.
The bot is little more than a heavy, treaded ring of barbed spikes. A haphazardly hung LED ticker sits atop its mass, flickering the words "Morning Star", confirming your suspicions as to its nature.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Drunk with bloodlust, the crowd is now screaming, as the robot backs away once more from the stumbling, bleeding man. The bot rams him into the wall one more time, and backs away, this time with a human stuck on its spikes. The crowd cries out in ecstasy, which eventually simmers down to a rabble as the arena service personnel remove the entrails.
Your mouth agape, you suddenly feel a wave of nausea. You begin looking around, panicked.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You look down at your hands, then glance at the crowd. Holding your hands low, you start rubbing the stamp, trying to remove the identifier.
"Word is, you've got a good medical plan." The voice startles you, even amidst the shouting crowd, and you turn to find a young man with an old face. He looks to be of Asian descent, with hair like a mop, big aviator glasses, and an improbably white fur coat.
"Tsk tsk. You don't think they've thought of that?" He's visibly amused. "Dude, lambs die in the pit. Vultures watch. Whaddya think happens to guys wit' NO number?" His hand starts circling his stomach in mock hunger. "Mmmm. Barbecue!" He laughs giddily. This guy may be insane.
Then it occurs to you, and that nausea comes back.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Spotting the door you came in, you start pushing your way through the crowd. Maybe you can hand in your chit, get your stuff, and go. Hell, maybe you should just forget the stuff and leave before anyone notices you.
"Hold it, dude." The voice startles you, even amidst the shouting crowd, and you turn to find a young man with an old face. He looks to be of Asian descent, with hair like a mop, big aviator glasses, and an improbably white fur coat.
"You really think you're just gonna walk back out the way you came in?" He's visibly amused. You don't notice any weapons, but then again, in that outfit...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Out in the robot prep yard, mechanics are tending to their creations. Your companion stops alongside a tall robot, reminiscent of a farm combine. You shudder to think what it does to a human with those blades, but then, something inside moves. Crawling out the feederhouse behind the blades is a mechanic, who looks around, and satisfied, waves another out. The second looks more like one of the patrons than a mechanic: starved and scared.
The pair skulk along the fenceline, and disappear out of sight.
Fur coat guy turns back to you, with a proud, yet devious grin on his face. "The Stoat is pleased to make your acquaintance. Now, about that medical plan..." He suggestively taps his wrist.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You snap the printed bracelet from your wrist, and hand it to him. He slides it through his fingers, reading the lettering on the strap.
"Niiice, dude," he bobs his head, "I may have to do an expedition there. And, and! Nice naaaame, ha ha." He pulls a box out from under a flightcase near the combine bot.
"Here." He opens the box. "Unclaimed lost and found, let's say."

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Unsure whether you want to give up the strap, you self-consciously fidget with it a moment, then read it over once more. Instead, you decide to share the facility address, but keep your name to yourself.
"Smart," he says, tapping the side of his head with his index finger. "You're a smart dude. Tell you what." He pulls a box out from under a flight case near the combine bot.
"Here." He opens the box. "Unclaimed lost and found, let's say. As for me, I may have to check into your fancy clinic soon. I think I'm coming down with a little something." He fake coughs and clears his throat, grinning.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
He looks over your shoulder. "Oh, also, you'll probably want these back."
You turn, and see a familiar face from the front gate. She drops your checked items in a lockbox.
You cast a glance back at The Stoat, and he shrugs. "What? I can't do this alone."
"Your safest bet is to go along the fence, where they went." He thumbs over his shoulder, indicating the route the mechanic and patron followed. "Unless you're still hungry?" He laughs, mocking a vomiting motion.
"See you around, dude!" he calls over his shoulder, walking back to the warehouse.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You look down at your hands, then glance at the crowd. Holding your hands low, you start rubbing the stamp, trying to remove the identifier.
"Cheater!" The words freeze you in place. A tingle of heat pricks your temples as you chastise yourself for getting into this mess.
"Cheater! Cheater!" the cries repeat, and then a chorus of echoes follows. A commotion starts around you, and a hand grabs your arm. You wrench it free, and more hands seize you in response. You're hoisted into the air by the swirling mob, and carried towards the gate.
"Hooooo! What have we here?" the announcer shouts, PA system buzzing with feedback. Your body careens ever closer to the gate, the crowd gleefully shouting and hooting from below.
Steeling your nerves, you prepare to fight whatever they throw at you.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Spotting the way you came in, you decide to split. Maybe you can hand in your chit, get your stuff, and go. Hell, maybe you should just forget the stuff and leave before anyone notices you.
Hazarding a glance back at the arena, they're still dragging remains from the floor. Maybe you'll reach the door before they're done. You push back through the crowd, glancing off shoulders and elbows as you go.
Every body you clear, though, seems to be replaced by two more dirty, hungry corpses. All move like a river's current from the door toward the grill, directly opposing your progress. Your hands start to grow clammy as you panic, feeling your time slip away.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
But your course suddenly veers, and you're carried towards the wall closest to the gate. As the wall nears, you notice sheets of plastic covering the opening to a chute, smeared with gore.
Head-first, you're tossed into the chute. Warm, slimy gore lubricates your passage, and you're dumped into darkness. The floor here feels squishy, and the air is thick with rancid humidity.
Suddenly, a section of wall slides away, and you're blinded by orange light, and a blast of hot air. Something strikes your head, knocking you to the ground, and the smell of woodsmoke is the last thing you notice...

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The music drops out, and the announcer's hateful voice resounds.
"Can you count, suckas!" The ritual is starting again. "I said, can you count, suckas!" The chorus of madness ensues.
"Raise those numbers!" You raise your fist in defeat. The music changes, lights switch to UV, numbers appear. The doorway casts a taunting light across the heads in front of you.
You hear him call your number almost before it happens, imagining the sounds of each digit in your head. Your body is swept up, and, too tired to struggle for their entertainment, you let yourself be carried back across the sea of people.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Suddenly, it occurs to you, snapping you out of your self-defeated daze. The dogman footage!
Clutching it in your hand, you wait for the right moment to catch the guard's attention.
When one grabs ahold of you, you shout, "Hey. Hey! Give this to your man upstairs!"
He bats your hand away, almost knocking the footage to the floor. You try once more. "Just give him the data! He'll thank you later."

table.name: encounters
table.column: Try Bargaining with dogman footage cont'd.

The doorway stands empty a moment longer, and then you see a curved, segmented leg strike the ground from one side. Another follows, then two more. A metallic monster almost three times your height pulls itself around the corner, and cheers of excitement boom throughout the warehouse.
Your stomach sinks as you take in the sight of the machine. A large, crushing arm swings menacingly from a platform, able to reach in any direction. It's supported by six radially symmetric legs. And under the chassis, a blade on an axle, much like the main rotor of a helicopter, except upside-down.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Try bargaining with dogman footage cont'd.

You turn to face it, looking it over desperately for angles of approach, when the music suddenly stops. Everyone starts looking around in confusion as lights dim.
"Awwwww, I gotta treat for y'all right here," the announcer croons. Hope wells up inside you again. "Feast your eyes on THIS!"
An image appears on the wall over the garage door, and as it comes into focus, you exhale in relief.
Larger than life, your battle with the dogman plays out for all to see. Patrons start belting out comments, and audibly wince as you pummel the beast. You hear a "GodDAMN, son!" from nearby.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The doorway stands empty a moment longer, and then you see a curved, segmented leg strike the ground from one side. Another follows, then two more. A metallic monster almost three times your height pulls itself around the corner, and cheers of excitement boom throughout the warehouse.
Your stomach sinks as you take in the sight of the machine. A large, crushing arm swings menacingly from a platform, able to reach in any direction. It's supported by six radially symmetric legs. And under the chassis, a blade on an axle, much like the main rotor of a helicopter, except upside-down.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You watch closely as the robot approaches. It's a clever design, those radial legs. Can switch direction fast, and no need to turn around. The armature, too. Its range of motion is near complete save for the area under the chassis, which has a rotor blade that could probably make short work of you.
You let it get a bit closer, then bolt around to the other side of it, backpedaling to the other side of the arena. The robot's walk seems to track you directly, and the arm swings to face you a moment later.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The robot's design looks pretty comprehensive. The claw can reach just about everything except directly below the chassis, and that blade would finish anything fool enough to hide there.
Though you bet you could get that arm to overextend itself. You'd have to get out of the way fast, but there would be a moment where the arm is exposed and in reach.
The robot is close now, so that plan will have to do. You crouch in preparation of the attack, ready to jump to the side. The arm launches forward, and you quickly roll to the side. The arm sweeps right, belting you hard, and sending you sprawling across the dirt.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You quickly scan the arena for potential snares. It's slim pickings here, however. The arena is mostly flat, with smooth walls. About the only thing you have to work with are the occasional pillar, and the robot itself. You decide to try and leverage one of those pillars.
As the robot scuttles toward you, you veer to the side, and put the pillar between you and it. Unsurprisingly, the robot arcs its path accordingly. Must be able to pathfind around obstacles. Should've figured.
Closer now, you've got a better idea of the scale of the bot, and a new plan forms in your head. You stick to the pillar, aiming to keep it between you both. Predictably, the robot continues to arc into a clear path. However, as it closes, it has to sidestep further to clear the pillar. As it approaches melee range, it spends more time sidestepping than approaching.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You decide to try and wear this thing down. It's gotta have a power supply, you wager, and you can probably keep it moving long enough to run it dry.
As it closes to melee range, you roll to the side, running past it to the other end of the arena. Turning to face it, you're surprised at how close it is already. You get ready to spring again, dodging to the side when the robot reaches you.
Watching this time as you pass, you start to see the flaw in your plan: the robot's ability to change direction without turning almost invalidates your dodge. It's closing the gap much faster than you expected. You double your efforts, sprinting to the far side, hoping your speed buys you time to dodge the next pass.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The arena doesn't offer much in the way of cover, by design. However, looking over the robot, it looks like the arm can't reach below the chassis. Judging by the rotor blade underneath, the designer anticipated this weakness.
Still, the spot directly under this bot may be the safest in the arena, if you can manage to stay there, and below the height of that rotor. A wave of giddiness sweeps over you at the sheer absurdity of this plan.
As the unit scuttles toward you, you drop to a sprinter's stance. Its arm swivels your way, claws open, wide enough to encircle a man's torso. Just before it reaches striking range, you kick off, darting between the two closest legs, and rolling to a stop directly below the rotor axle. A roar of approval rushes through the crowd.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
The robot's design looks pretty comprehensive. The claw can reach just about everything except directly below the chassis, and that blade would finish anything fool enough to hide there.
However, it looks like the legs need to lift to accommodate the blade's passage. In fact, you bet it works a lot like those old biplane machine guns, timed to fire between rotor passages. Maybe you can get one of those legs to trip up the timing mechanism...
Time's up, the thing is almost upon you now. There might be another plan, but time for sussing it out isn't a luxury you have. As the unit scuttles toward you, you bolt forward, screaming like a lunatic. Shouts of approval roar up from the crowd, a mixture of amusement and approval. At the last moment, you jump for one of the legs, aiming low both to clear the blade and maximize your leverage.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Then there's a sound, like a clutch disengaging, and the rotor drops a few inches. The robot legs start lifting and dropping in rapid succession, in unison with the rapidly accelerating blade. You feel the rushing air from the blade, inches above your prone body.
The robot starts to move, arm pointed the opposite direction, ready to pick up anything left behind.
Flat against your back, you deftly sweep your arms and legs to propel yourself in tandem with the robot. A moment of surprise seizes the audience, followed by a redoubling of cheers. The dance continues around the arena, blade unable to lower, and robot unable to shake its human shadow.
It's a stalemate. And while the robot might have the juice to outlast you, the audience definitely doesn't.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Then there's a sound, like a clutch disengaging, and the rotor vaults into spinning death with frightening speed and power. There's a blur of up-down twitches as the blade passes the preceding legs, following by a bone-jarring "clank!"
Your body is flung across the arena, part of a spider leg skittering alongside you, and the blade rips through two additional legs before shattering in a storm of shards. The robot lists, crashing on its side, its remaining legs scrabbling and the rotor axle whining at high speed.
Somewhere in the audience, you hear screams of agony. Probably someone with rotor shrapnel in their gut.

table.name: encounters
table.column: Try to trap the bot cont'd.

Finally, you start luring it clockwise around the pillar. The crab legs start colliding with the wall as it tries to jam itself into the space between the wall and the pillar. Its chassis lifts precariously as it grinds against the wall, slowing to a halt, legs scratching and flailing. Your heart skips a beat at the thought of defeating the hulking metal beast.
But then its flailing manages to dislodge it, and the bot starts righting itself again.
Remembering the undercarriage rotor, you make a daring slide below the chassis, under the hypotenuse of the blade's plane against the wall. You flatten yourself as much as possible, shielding your face.
As you hoped, the blade engages, violently whipping around, sparking off the pillar and lodging into the wall. The robot writhes in place, legs ineffectual, as you slide out from underneath.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You stand up, dart to the opposite wall, and duck again. For good measure, you feign running one direction as you duck, then deke backward once below the lip. The robot closes to where you were, sweeping away from you, along the wall.
Something doesn't add up. The bot's rigged to look like it's autonomous, but you're pretty sure it's being remote-controlled, and from someone on this side of the warehouse.
The rotor blade spins up. It's got to be a human controller. He'll probably skirt this wall with the blade on, hoping to catch you in his blindspot with the area effect weapon. The robot would've seen you by now.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You decide to call this guy out. You walk calmly out to the center of the arena, turn to face the crowd he's likely in, and cross your arms, as if waiting. If he comes after you, it'll reveal to most that there indeed was a blindspot along that wall.
The pilot, wherever he is, must've realized his error. The robot continues its sweep of the wall, crashing into the corner by the garage door, and scrabbles ineffectually there.
